contentList.content: A mastery scroll. Meet the mastery requirement to unlock the scroll and learn the secrets within.
While Warfare skills are typically for warriors, specialized mages have bridged the gap via intense close combat training. Read this book to learn this skill.
An old blindfold, said to once belong to a monk in a distance land. By choosing to cloak the perceived world in darkness, the monk found her inner strength grow.

A prototype weapon capable of firing dense lead pellets at a dangerous velocity.
Fits onto your belt.
A handmade quiver. Comfortably fits arrows of both normal size and greater.

An small crossbow with a wrist strap and easy-to-reach trigger. Fits comfortably on your arm.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

The product of Dwarven technology and mysticism, this cannon fits snugly on your arm.
Powered by runes, the Runic Cannon is capable of harnessing magic at level once thought to be impossible without Source.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.
A backpack designed for any would-be demolitionist. Houses a plethora of unexploded ordinance.

A pistol said to once below to the Sword Saint Isshin.
Weighty, yet fits well in your hand, and comes with an attachment to wear it on your waist.
Automatically levels up with the wearer.

A gauntlet once worn by a notorious demon. Seems to occasionally twitch.
Gains power from slain enemies.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

Special tattoos that grant the bearer tremendous strength.
The tattoos glow a fierce red.
Special tattoos that grant the bearer tremendous strength.
An empty glass flask, perfect for housing liquid you'd like to relocate.
While the surface of this ball is hard, one good toss will unleash the contents upon an area.
You got it, chief. Call me if you need help again.
*Tell the mercenary to stop following you.*
Reset Balrin's Throwing Axe - Use this if your axe never came back.
*[S. POTIONS] Click on the button labeled 'Special Potions'.*
*[ANY ARMOR] Click on the button labeled 'Any Armor'.*
*[CLOTH ARMOR] Click on the button labeled 'Cloth Armor'.*
*[HEAVY ARMOR] Click on the button labeled 'Heavy Armor'.*
*[LIGHT ARMOR] Click on the button labeled 'Light Armor'.*
*[MAGE ARMOR] Click on the button labeled 'Mage Armor'.*
*[ARCHER WEAPON] Click on the button labeled 'Ranger Weapons'.*
*[ROGUE WEAPONS] Click on the button labeled 'Rogue Weapons'.*
*[WARRIOR WEAPONS] Click on the button labeled 'Warrior Weapons'.*
*[ANY WEAPON] Click on the button labeled 'Any Weapon'.*
*[WIZARD WEAPONS] Click on the button labeled 'Wizard Weapons'.*
A ring made to defy the gods.

A handmade quiver, designed for quickly drawing arrows.
Quickdraw quivers recharge automatically outside of combat.

A handmade quiver, designed for quickly drawing arrows. Once owned by an archer named 'Trusy Nick', who was said to always carry a variety of arrows.
Quickdraw quivers recharge automatically outside of combat.

A handmade quiver, designed for quickly drawing arrows. Once owned by an archer named 'Trusy Nick', who was said to always carry a variety of arrows.
Quickdraw quivers recharge automatically outside of combat.

A handmade quiver, designed for quickly drawing arrows. Once owned by an archer named 'Trusy Nick', who was said to always carry a variety of arrows.
Quickdraw quivers recharge automatically outside of combat.

A handmade quiver, designed for quickly drawing arrows. Once owned by an archer named 'Trusy Nick', who was said to always carry a variety of arrows.
Quickdraw quivers recharge automatically outside of combat.

A handmade quiver, designed for quickly drawing arrows. Once owned by an archer named 'Trusy Nick', who was said to always carry a variety of arrows.
Quickdraw quivers recharge automatically outside of combat.
Now you'll truly never miss your programs.
'Perfect for peppering your enemies with K.N.O.W.L.E.D.G.E.'
General Ford's Manual for Tactical Warfare
If knowledge is power, a book can conquer the world.
Chaotic Walls of the Black Ring
Twin Guards of the Elder Tree
Selene & Helios, Defenders of the Divine
Oaken Aegis, Shield of the Divine
An old greatbow passed down as a family heirloom. Not the strongest, but it'll do.
The iron-hard fist of a Brawler. Strikes true.
<font color='#CD1F1F'>Throwing Failed - You already threw Balrin's Axe!</font>
<font color='#CD1F1F'>The focus required to wield the Runic Cannon requires it to be the only weapon used.</font>
<font color='#CD1F1F'>Bolts can only be inserted into an arm-mounted crossbow!</font>
<font color='#ff4800'>Your right hand surges with the power of the Eternal Spark.</font>
<font color='#FF1155' size='22'>Insert Failed - No Hand Crossbow Equipped</font>
<font color='#FF001F'>The orb doesn't seem to fit. A special gauntlet is required.</font>
<font color='#CD1F1F'>To unequip the Dragon Bone Claws, unequip your glove armor instead of the weapon.</font>
A contract killer who slays their prey with a pair of deadly blades, whether motivated by political, religious, or financial means
A wanderer who wields a foreign blade, slaying evil as they pursue their own code of justice
Sorcerors who wield the power of Chaos, leveraging luck and foresight to lay waste upon the battlefield

A former marksman from a long-forgotten regiment, tasked with destroying dragonkind. With their unyielding strength, Dragon Slayers utilize Greatbows to pierce their enemies with arrows the size of spears
A former gladiator whose repertoire of blade skills once amazed crowds and foes alike
A warrior who wields the deadly halberd, a combination of spear and axe, taking advantage of the reach and versatility it offers
Disciplined warriors who wield quarterstaffs, overwhelming enemies with finesse and sheer force of will
Disciplined warriors who wield metal quarterstaffs, overwhelming enemies with strength and sheer force of will.
Adventurers who sail the high seas in search of treasure and opportunity. Equipped with a flintlock pistol, pirates tend to fire explosive lead when their enemies least expect it

A marksman armed with a new weapon predicted to change the art of war - The Rifle. Steel, wood, and a mysterious alchemical compound combine to create explosions that propel lead at break-neck speeds, piercing armor and flesh with ease

Adept mages who train in the ways of the sword, using special 'Runeblades' as a conduit to enhance their magic. Crafty use of the runes etched upon their blades allow Runic Knights to weave their attacks and spells together, devastating the battlefield
A warrior who strives to defend the innocent through a unique style that utilizes dual shields

Channel a torrent of water through your hand, setting Wet on targets hit for 2 turns, and dousing burning surfaces.
If a Burning Ally is Doused, Mending is applied for 1 turn.
Mending restores [1] and does not damage the Undead.
Allies hit are cleansed of Slowed and Enwebbed.
Haunt the target enemy, dealing [1] and apply Cursed.

Shoot a bolt of pure void energy that deals [1] Chaos Damage and creates a corresponding surface.
Each bolt has a [2] chance to fork to a new target, up to [3] times max.

Magic Warfare
Rush forward in a straight line, to a designated point, hitting all enemies in your path for [1] and setting Knockdown.

Draw a random, temporary arrow from your quiver.
Arrows retrieved this way disappear after combat ends.
The sure-fire, instant death wombo combo, done live.

Temporarily gain a few Zombie-like traits, gaining <font color='#9A5085'>[1]% Lifesteal</font>, <font color='#00AA00'>[2]% Poison Resistance</font>, and bleeding <font color='#65C900'>Poison</font> when hit for 2 turns.

Magic Warfare
Cripple all enemies within [1] of the target. Deals [2].
Claim the soul of the target character. If they die, fully resurrect your body.

Temporarily zombify an ally, granting them <font color='#9A5085'>[1]% Lifesteal</font>, <font color='#00AA00'>[2]% Poison Resistance</font>, and bleeding <font color='#65C900'>Poison</font> when hit for 2 turns.

Rally the party at the target location.
Party members are granted a one-time use skill that teleports them to the raised banner.

Rally the party at the target location.
Party members are granted a one-time use skill that teleports them to the raised banner.
The banner inspires faith in the Divine, granting a [1] boost to attributes, [2] boost to dodge, and [3] boost to damage.

Rally the party at the target location.
Party members are granted a one-time use skill that teleports them to the raised banner.
The banner unleashes the hunger of the pack, granting [1]% lifesteal and a [2] boost to damage.
Heed the rallying cry of the Standard-Bearer, teleporting to the raised banner.

Lead your allies into a strategic charge, increasing Movement Speed by [1]%, Initiative by [2], and the damage of the first attack by [3]%.
Range of the War Charge scales with Leadership.

Throw the breach charge at a target position.
Detonating this charge breaks locks up to level 10 in a [1] radius, and knocking back objects within [2].

Throw the displacement charge at a target position.
Detonating this charge randomly teleports characters and barrels within [1] to another displacement charge within 12m.

Throw the remote charge at a target position.
Detonating this charge deals [1] in a [2] radius.

Throw the poison gas charge at a target position.
Detonating this charge deals [1] in a [2] radius and creates a poison cloud.

Throw the shrapnel charge at a target position.
Detonating this charge deals [1] in a [2] radius and applies Bleeding for 2 turns.
If targets hit are already bleeding, their wounds Rupture for [3].

Throw the tar charge at a target position.
Detonating this charge deals [1] in a [2] radius, turns water into oil, and applies Tarred for 2 turns.
Tarred reduces Fire Resistance, Movement Speed, and lets Burning bypass Magic Armor.
Retrieve a random remote charge from the <font color='#C7A758'>Demolitionist's Backpack</font>.

Detonate remote charges in a [1] radius.
Can target mines in the world, or an object holding mines.
Only 5 mines max can be detonated in an inventory.

Throw your mainhand shield at an enemy. The shield can ricochet up to 3 times within [1], dealing [2] damage and restoring [3] and [4] for each enemy hit.
The shield then returns, restoring an additional amount of armor.
Shield Mastery I
If 3 targets are hit, restore [5] and [6] to allies within 8m.

Bolster your defenses, restoring the armor of your shields, and gaining a [1] boost to your armor values until your next turn.
When hunkering down, you will be Grounded and be unable to move, while becoming a priority target for enemies.
Critical hit damage taken is reduced by 50%.

Dual Shields Mastery III
Slam the target in an Iron Maiden, dealing [1].
If the target is in a Shield Prison, deal an extra [2] and apply Dazed.
Applies Bleeding, and Ruptures Bleeding targets for [3].
A hardy blow with your shield that deals [1] and has a chance to daze the target.

Dual Shields Mastery I
Cover a target character remotely for 3 turns, redirecting 50% of the damage they take to you.
The first time the target gets attacked, rush to their position and counter-attack the attacker for [1], and grant the target temporary damage resistance.

Dual Shields Mastery II
Encase the target in a hardened shell, removing them from combat for 1 turn.
Allies gain +2 AP upon being freed.

Launch a dud at a target position, dealing [1].
After 3 turns in combat (any source), the dud explodes for [2] in a [3] radius.
If the dud is destroyed before being fully armed, it deals [4] instead.

Fire a spread of 3 bullets at a target, dealing [1] per bullet.
If all 3 bullets hit the same target, knock them back 4m and deal an additional [2].

Fire your blunderbuss at a target for [1].
Electrifies surfaces.
Fire your blunderbuss at a target for [1].
Fire your blunderbuss at a target for [1].
Fire your blunderbuss at a target for [1].

Fire your blunderbuss at a target for [1].
Ignites surfaces.

Fire your blunderbuss at a target for [1].
Freezes surfaces.

Fire your blunderbuss at a target for [1].
Contaminates surfaces.

Fire your blunderbuss at a target for [1].
Douses surfaces.
Fire 15 bullets in a [1] degree arc. Each bullet deals [2].
A shot that deals [1] and receives [2]% bonus damage per 1m distance to target.
Fire three bullets at three targets of your choice, each dealing [1].
Shoot a bullet that goes straight through enemies. Each enemy that's hit takes [1], ignoring Armour.
Fire a bullet that deals [3] and bounces to another target within [2]. Forks up to [1] times.
Leap into the air before shooting, gaining damage bonuses for your superior height. Deals [1].
Attack your target with meticulous aim, dealing [1] in one shot. When performed from Stealth, this attack gains a 50% damage increase.

Take a focused shot on a target within [1], dealing an average of [2] (10m), depending on distance to the target (20m max).
If the target is Marked, deal a critical hit.
Aimed Shot provides an immense accuracy boost to ensure it always hits.
Attune your firearm to the element of a target surface, gaining a <font color='#b54efe'>basic attack replacement skill</font> for 2 turns.

Shoot your equipped pistol in a straight line at a target, dealing [1] (or [2]).
Bullets fired from a pistol travel in a straight line, well beyond your limited targeting range.
When firing from a different height than your target, the bullet will travel at an angle.
Damage scales with your equipped weapon. If no weapon is equipped, the second damage value is used.

Fire a massive, super-heated cannonball, dealing [1] to targets, knocking them down, and leaving behind a trail of explosive fire clouds.
At the end of the trail, the cannonball explodes for [2] in a [3] radius, applying Necrofire to targets hit for 1 turn.

Greatbow Mastery I
Fire a cushioned arrow that knocks the target 4m-12m away, depending on how close you are.
Targets hit deal [1] to enemy characters and [2] to items as they fly through the air.
If the initial target hit is an enemy, they take [3](3m) to [4](12m) from the distance launched, and [5](4m) to [6](20m) from the height fallen.

Greatbow Mastery I
Fire an arrow that pierces up to [1] enemies, dealing [2] and applying Knocked Down.
When hitting a dragon, apply Dragon's Bane, dealing [3] and reducing the dragon's Movement Speed by [4]% and Dodge by [5]%.

Greatbow Mastery II
Designate a target position. After 3 turns in combat, a bombardment of [1] great arrows strike that position, each dealing [2].
Immobilized targets take an additional [3] per hit.
Summon a large burst of wind from your Grimoire, dealing [1], clearing non-cursed surfaces, and pushing enemies back [2].

Propel yourself to a target location.
Translocation Magic
If the Translocation Grimoire is active, enemies you pass by receive Translocation Damage and are knocked down (resisted by Magic Armor). Allies passed receive Translocation Surge. Additionally, you also receive Translocation Surge.

Activate the Death Magic within your Grimoire.
Necromancy-based skills have a chance to inflict a random status ailment on enemies.
Gain the Torment Soul skill.

Exude an aura of death for 4 turns. When an enemy dies, their soul erupts for [1] and sets a stack of Soul Burn on surrounding enemies within [2] range.
Allies (and you) create a Tormented Ghost upon death, haunting the battlefield for 3 turns.
If the Tormented Ghost slays an enemy, their body is resurrected.

Gain the Eternal Spark in your main hand, granting the ability to throw fire for [1] (Scales with Intelligence).
Attacking a Burning target with the Eternal Spark cleanses Burning and deals [2] in a [3] radius, while additionally granting a 2% stacking damage bonus (max 5 stacks).

Activate the Mimicry Magic within your Grimoire.
Every 3 turns, the grimoire will copy the first non-source skill you cast.

Activate the Translocation Magic within your Grimoire.
Upon teleporting an enemy, apply Translocation Damage, dealing [1].
When teleporting an ally or yourself, apply Translocation Surge, granting +[2]% Movement Speed, +[3]% Damage, +[4]% Critical Chance, and healing [5].

Activate the Fire Magic within your Grimoire.
When casting a fire-type target, projectile, or projectile strike spell on an enemy or position, a Fire Cloud is created at that location.
When Burning is applied to you, gain a 2% stacking damage bonus (max 5 stacks).
If Necrofire is applied to you, 10% Vitality/Armour/Magic Armour is restored.

Activate the Wind Magic within your Grimoire.
Upon casting an Air skill on an enemy or position, the Grimoire shoots Wind Magic at the target for [1].

Gain a one-time use copy of the last skill a target used.
If the skill is already known, no copy is granted.

Torment the soul of a character or corpse.
If the target is dead, create a Ghost that haunts the battlefield for 2 turns.
If the target is alive, apply Tormented for 2 turns, dealing [1] within a [2] radius when they die, and creating a Ghost.
If you die within 2 turns after casting this skill, haunt the battlefield as a Ghost.
Party members who slay an enemy while in Ghost Form will be resurrected.

Randomly swap the positions of objects caught within [1].
Translocation Magic
If the Translocation Grimoire is active, apply Translocation Damage to enemies, and Translocation Surge to allies.

Fire a decisive shot at a target with your Hand Crossbow, dealing [1].
Deals double damage from stealth.

Shoot your Hand Crossbow at a target, dealing [1](or [2]) and consuming a charge.
Damage scales with your equipped weapon. If no weapon is equipped, the second damage value is used.

Shoot your Hand Crossbow at a target, dealing [1] and consuming a charge.
Applies equipped weapon properties on hit.

Reload your Hand Crossbow with the inserted crossbow bolt.
Requires crossbow bolts in the rune slot.

(Placeholder)
Unleash the magic within the Raizan, attacking 5 times with astonishing speed, each hit dealing [1].

Katana Mastery I
In a swift display of skill, instantly rend enemies in a line, dealing [1].
Consumes all stacks of Blademaster's Strike on targets hit, dealing [2] per stack, and rupturing their wounds for [3] every 3 stacks.

Katana Mastery II
Instantly teleport to enemies marked with Blademaster's Strike, dealing [1] on hit, and consuming each stack for [2] each.
If an enemy dies, Blademaster's Strike is spread to enemies within 6m.

Swing your blade down upon an opponent's head, dealing [1] + [2] + [3].
Corrosive damage breaks physical armor, while magic damage breaks magic armor.

Call forth the Raizan through the Shiden, Thunder Orb, gaining a unique katana.
When unequipping the Raizan, the Oni Gauntlet, or the Shiden, Thunder Orb, the Raizan will return to the gauntlet.

Monk Technique
Sweep the ground around you within a [1] radius, hitting enemies for [1] and applying Tripping for 2 turns.
Tripping bypasses armor.
When enemies that are Tripping move, they have a 15% chance to be Knocked Down.
Enemies that are already Tripping are Knocked Down instantly.
Tripping is removed by Knocked Down, First Aid, Fortified, and Soul Mate.

Rapier Mastery III
Jump between [1] targets within [2], dealing [3].
Upon hit, there is a 25% chance to gain a Frenzy Charge.
Flicker Strike consumes Frenzy Charges to continue jumping, dealing [4] per hit.

Rapier Mastery I
Take a stance that enhances guile and speed.
While your offhand is empty, gain [1]% Damage, [2], [3], and [4]% additional Movement Speed.
Critical/Backstab attacks grant +[5] AP once every 2 turns.
Weapon attacks and skill will do an additional [6].

Rapier Mastery II
A follow up blow to Sucker Punch that deals [1].
If the target is Knocked Down, Dizzy is applied for 2 turns when they stand up.
Single-use skill.

Rapier Mastery II
A follow up blow to Dizzying Smash that deals [1] and pushes the target back 3m.
If the target is Knocked Down, enemies they collide with have a chance to be knocked down, and both they and the target take [2] per collision.
On hit, refreshes the cooldown for Sucker Punch.
Single-use skill.
Launch a magical missile from your rod that deals <font color='#b823cb'>[1] Chaos Damage</font>, and creates a random surface.
Launch a magical missile from your rod that deals [1], and creates a surface of the related element.

Swap between using the Scepter of Magic Missile as a rod or wand.
Bonus: When the Scepter of Magic Missile hits a target with no Magic Armour, they take [1].
Unleash chaotic energy within the Chaos Edge, creating 5 random cone-shaped surfaces in a 60 degree arc infront of you.

Send out an beam of pure Chaos energy, dealing [1] Chaos Damage and creating a random elemental surface at the target.
The surface is also created beneath the beam as it travels.

Activate the Air Rune within your Runeblade, adding [1] to melee attacks.
Enemies hit have a 10% chance to become Shocked for 1 turn.
Wet increases this chance to 50%.

Activate the Chaos Rune within your Runeblade to absorb the element of surfaces within 1.5m.
Absorbed elements are then activated as if you had a Runes of that type.
Surfaces of the following elements can be absorbed:
Fire, Water, Ice, Electrified Water, Oil, Poison, and Blood.

Activate the Earth Rune within your Runeblade, adding [1] to melee attacks.
Enemies hit have a 20% chance to be Slowed for 1 turn.

Activate the Fire Rune within your Runeblade, adding [1] to melee attacks.
Applies Burning to enemies hit for 1 turn.

Activate the Ice Rune within your Runeblade, adding [1] to melee attacks.
Applies Chilled to enemies hit for 1 turn. Enemies already Chilled have a 20% chance to become Frozen.

Activate the Poison Rune within your Runeblade, adding [1] to melee attacks.
Applies Poisoned to enemies hit for 1 turn.

Activate the Water Rune within your Runeblade, adding [1] to melee attacks.
Applies Wet to enemies hit for 1 turn.

Runeblade Mastery
Reverberate the last active rune or rune combination, applying it for 2 turns.

Explode a Poisoned target, dealing [1] and an additional explosion of Poison Damage to enemies in a 3m-6m range.
The explosion damage scales with the target's Poisoned duration:
1 Turn: [2]
2 Turns: [3]
3 Turns: [4]
4 Turns: [5]
5 Turns: [6]
6 Turns: [7]
Throw a weapon at an enemy for [1].

Throw a blunt weapon at an enemy for [1]. Applies Dazed and Blunt Trauma, with a chance to knock the enemy down.
Dazed lowers Accuracy by [2]% per stack.
Blunt Trauma lowers Movement Speed by [3], Dodge by [4], and does [5] per turn.

Throw a chair weapon at an enemy for [1]. Applies Dazed and Blunt Trauma, with a chance to knock the enemy down.
Dazed lowers Accuracy by [2]% per stack.
Blunt Trauma lowers Movement Speed by [3], Dodge by [4], and does [5] per turn.
Throw the flask at the target position, dousing objects hit in a nasty liquid that lowers <font color='#7478DC'>Air Resistance</font> by <font color='#DD0000'>[1]%</font> for 2 turns.
Throw the flask at the target position, dousing objects hit in a nasty liquid that lowers <font color='#D040D0'>All Resistances</font> by <font color='#DD0000'>[1]%</font> for 2 turns.
Throw the flask at the target position, dousing objects hit in a nasty liquid that lowers <font color='#AA895B'>Earth Resistance</font> by <font color='#DD0000'>[1]%</font> for 2 turns.
Throw the flask at the target position, dousing objects hit in a nasty liquid that lowers <font color='#C76537'>Fire Resistance</font> by <font color='#DD0000'>[1]%</font> for 2 turns.
Throw the flask at the target position, dousing objects hit in a nasty liquid that lowers <font color='#00AA00'>Poison Resistance</font> by <font color='#DD0000'>[1]%</font> for 2 turns.
Throw the flask at the target position, dousing objects hit in a nasty liquid that lowers <font color='#188EDE'>Water Resistance</font> by <font color='#DD0000'>[1]%</font> for 2 turns.

Throw a bladed weapon at an enemy for [1]. Applies Impaled and Internal Damage.
Impaled lowers Movement Speed by [2]% per weapon stuck inside the enemy.
Internal Damage lowers AP Recovery/Start/Maximum by [3], and does [4] per turn.

Throw a stone at an enemy for [1], with a chance to give them a Concussion.
Enemies suffering from a Concussion have a small chance to Fumble their basic attacks.

Throw Kevin at an enemy for [1], with a chance to give them a Concussion.
Enemies suffering from a Concussion have a small chance to Fumble their basic attacks.
Kevin will ricochet to hit [2] additional enemies in a [3] radius.

Throw Kevin at an enemy for [1].
If Kevin's target is already Bleeding, their wound will Rupture, dealing [2] initially and per turn.
Kevin will ricochet to hit [3] additional enemies in a [4] radius.

Throw Kevin at an enemy for [1].
If Kevin's target is Burning, mini-explosions will occur, hitting enemies for [2] in a [3] radius.
Kevin will ricochet to hit [4] additional enemies in a [5] radius.

Throw Kevin at an enemy for [1].
If Kevin's target is Burning, mini-explosions will occur, hitting enemies for [2] in a [3] radius.
Kevin will ricochet to hit [4] additional enemies in a [5] radius.

Throw a scythe at an enemy for [1]. Applies Impaled.
Impaled lowers Movement Speed by [2]% per weapon stuck inside the enemy.
Enemies below 5% max health will be Reaped, resulting in instant-death.

Throw a shield at an enemy for [1]. Applies Dazed and Blunt Trauma, with a chance to knock the enemy unconscious.
Dazed lowers Accuracy by [2]% per stack.
Blunt Trauma lowers Movement Speed by [3], Dodge by [4], and does [5] per turn.

Throw a shuriken at an enemy for [1]. Applies Impaled and Bleeding.
Impaled lowers Movement Speed by [2]% per weapon stuck inside the enemy.
Shurikens do 50% more damage while Sneaking or Invisible.

Throw an exploding shuriken at an enemy for [1] in a [2] radius. Applies Burning.
Shurikens do 50% more damage while Sneaking or Invisible.

Throw a poisen-tipped shuriken at an enemy for [1]. Applies Impaled and Poisoned for 2 turns.
Impaled lowers Movement Speed by [2]% per weapon stuck inside the enemy.
Shurikens do 50% more damage while Sneaking or Invisible.

Throw a staff at an enemy for [1] and apply Staff Infection, with a chance to knock the enemy down.
Staff Infection lowers all Elemental Resistances [2]%.
When hit by a staff, it explodes with a random element.

Throw Balrin's Throwing Axe at an enemy for [1], with a [6]% damage bonus per 1m distance to the target.Lose your axe for 2 turns, or until you get within [4]m of the target and retrieve it, dealing [5].
If the target dies from initial damage, refresh the cooldown of this skill.
Targets hit are Impaled for 2 turns, lowering Movement Speed by [2]% and Piercing Resistance by [3]%.

Throw a wand at an enemy for [1] and apply Flabbergasted, with a small chance to knock the enemy down.
Flabbergasted lowers all Elemental Resistances [2]%.
When hit by a wand, it explodes, creating a random surface.

Throw your equipped weapon(s) at a target, dealing [1] and disarming yourself.
If the target dies from this skill, your weapons find their way back to you.
Prepare to throw <font color='#C7A758'>Balrin's Throwing Axe</font>, gaining a different skill depending on which hand wields the axe.

Throwing Mastery II
Launch a target 2m-11m away from you. Distance tossed scales with Strength.
At higher launch distances, the target deals [1] to [2] to surrounding enemies in a [3] to [4] radius when it lands.
Launching heavier targets requires higher levels of Strength
At 40 Strength, weight restrictions are lifted.
Damage and impact radius scale with the weight of the object.
Resisted by Grounded.
Attack with your <font color='#c5a65a'>Dragonblaze Flamethrower</font>, dealing [1] to enemies in a cone.

Reap the battlefield, dealing [1] to enemies in an arc.
Slain enemies provide a permanent, stacking damage bonus and restore source points.

Fire a concentrated mass of energy at a target, dealing ([1]|[3]) in a [2] radius.
Applies any active rune effect on hit.

Leap forward and slam the almighty Anvilmar into the ground, cracking the earth for [1] in a [2] radius, and knocking targets up.
Targets landing take [3] to [4] damage upon landing, depending on the launch height.
The impact radius begins where from your anvil hits the ground, which is 2m infront of your landing position.
Spin forward with the <font color='#c5a65a'>Warchief's Halberd</font>, hitting enemies in a [1] radius for [2].
Swap between two-handed and single-handed styles with the <font color='#c5a

Combine the Burial Blade into a scythe form, or switch back to a single-handed blade form.
Each form may have independent runes, crafting enhancements, and attribute scales.

Give into the insanity of the flame, exploding targets for [1] when you light them on fire with the Dragonblaze Flamethrower.
Move faster on fire surfaces, and gain immunity to Burning.
Removed by Wet, Chilled, or Frozen.

As is written on Gnak's Spell Scroll:
"Me no spell
hit bad with biggem
biggo boom!"
Repeating the words activates the magic within the scroll. Smashing something with the scroll will then explode a random, basic spell.
Possible spells include most starting spells, both hostile and beneficial (Fortity vs. Contamination), with a smaller chance at an adept or greater spell.

Swap your stance with the Warchief's Halberd, going between spear and axe mode.

Water Rune + Earth Rune
Enemies hit have a 40% chance to be encased in Snow, lowering AP Recovery/Start by [1], Movement Speed by [2]%, and dealing Water Damage with a chance to fall down when moving.
Adds Water Damage and Earth Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Blood Rune + Air Rune
Melee attacks restore Vitality to allies within [1]m.
Adds Piercing Damage and Air Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Character has absorbed <font color='#8B0000'>Blood</font> after activating the <font color='#b823cb'>Chaos Rune</font> within their <font color='#40E0D0'>Runeblade</font>. 20% chance to apply <font color='#FF0000'>Bleeding</font> to enemies hit for 1 turn (Resisted by Magic Armor).

Blood Rune + Earth Rune
Deals additional damage when attacking Undead, with a 10% chance to Entangle enemies hit for 1 turn.
Entangle's chance is increased to 50% when attacking the Undead.
Adds Piercing Damage and Earth Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Blood Rune + Fire Rune
Enemies attacked with a Runeblade are inflicted with Soul Burn, taking damage on apply and turn, and lowering Elemental Resistance by 5% per stack (5 max).
Adds Piercing Damage and Fire Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Blood Rune x 2
Every third basic attack grants a Congealed Blood Ball, which can be thrown to create a blood surface.

Blood Rune + Poison Rune
40% chance to apply Infectious Disease on enemies hit for 1 turn.
Adds Piercing Damage and Poison Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Blood Rune + Water Rune
Regenerates Vitality on application and turn.
Adds Piercing Damage and Water Damage to weapon attacks and skills.
Character has activated the <font color='#b823cb'>Chaos Rune</font> within their <font color='#40E0D0'>Runeblade</font>, and is absorbing an element in the environment.

Water Rune + Air Rune
Applies Shocked to Wet enemies for 1 turn, otherwise Wet is applied for 1 turn.
Attacking a Shocked or Stunned enemy sends out a jolt of electricity to other enemies within 8m.
When Shocked is applied, that enemy gets Shock Resistance, preventing Shocked from being applied by Runeblades for 3 turns.
Adds Water Damage and Air Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Water Rune + Poison Rune
If an attacked target is Poisoned, the poison spreads to nearby enemies within [1]m.
If the enemies the poison spreads to are already Poisoned, the contamination continues.
Adds Water Damage and Poison Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Character has activated the Death Rune from absorbing Deathfog.
Enemies hit with a Runeblade are marked with Death Sentence for 1 turn, and cannot be marked again for 4 turns.
When an enemy with Death Sentence dies, they return as a friendly Revenant for 2 turns.
Revenants do 50% less damage, and cannot be created from bosses.

Earth Rune + Air Rune
30% chance on hit to shoot out a cone of dust in a 7m range, applying Blinded to enemies for 1 turn and dealing minor Earth Damage.
Dust Blast can only occur once per turn.
Adds Earth Damage and Air Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Character has activated the Earth Rune within their Runeblade.
Enemies hit have a 20% chance to be Slowed for 1 turn.

Fire Rune + Poison Rune
40% chance to cause a Mini-Explosion on attack, dealing Fire Damage in a 2m range.
Adds Fire Damage and Poison Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Character has activated the Fire Rune within their Runeblade.
Applies Burning to enemies hit for 1 turn.

Poison Rune + Air Rune
On attack, 50% chance to spawn or expand a Gas Cloud on the target (once per turn).
Adds Poison Damage and Air Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Fire Rune + Air Rune
If an attacked target is Burning, a heatburst burns enemies within [1]m.
If a heatburst target is already Burning, the heatburst continues.
Adds Fire Damage and Air Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Water Rune x 2
Applies Chilled to enemies hit for 1 turn. Enemies already Chilled have a 20% chance to become Frozen.

Fire Rune x 2
Applies Burning to enemies hit for 1 turns, or extends the duration of Burning by 1 turn per attack (4 turns max).

Fire Rune + Earth Rune

Adds Fire Damage and Earth Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Character has activated the Poison Rune within their Runeblade.
Applies Poisoned to enemies hit for 1 turn.

Earth Rune x 2
Enemies hit have a 20% chance to be Slammed for 1 turn.
Slammed is a magic-based knockdown.

Water Rune + Fire Rune
Enemies hit have a 40% chance to get a Water Burn for 2 turns, dealing Water + Fire Damage per turn.
Wet enemies have their moisture Evaporated, dealing damage and removing Wet.
Adds Water Damage and Fire Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Earth Rune + Poison Rune
Enemies hit have a 40% chance to be encased in Tar makes Burning bypass armor checks.
Adds Earth Damage and Poison Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Air Rune x 2
Enemies hit have a 20% chance to be struck by a Thunderbolt, dealing Air Damage and chaining Lightning to enemies within 8m.
Wet increases this chance to 80%.Enemies can only be struck once per turn.

Poison Rune x 2
Applies Poisoned to enemies hit for 1 turn, or increases the duration of Poisoned by 1 turn per attack (4 turns max).

*The contraption idles in place, emitting a quiet hum.[LLWEAPONEX_VendingMachine_SaleStatus_b12f911c-7a98-4ff1-a35c-f2127335884f]*
*The machine shakes and bellows out a curt "Ding".* "Order complete! Check back soon to see more glorious treasure! Have a great--bzzzt--day."
[First] *Look at the top set of buttons.*
[Next] *Look at the next set of buttons.*
[Info] *You read the panel: "Hit a button to order a treasure type."*
[Last] *Look at the bottom set of buttons.*
*With a satisfying "click", you hit a button and select a treasure category.*
[Previous] *Look at the previous set of buttons.*
*The labels on the red buttons light up, as you hear a mechanic voice.* "Greetings [VALUED CUSTOMER]! Place an order, and be amazed as our stock of weaponry changes at the next available cycle!"
*You take a look at the trader's wares.*

This rifle is slightly more suited to long-range sharpshooters.
A greatbow arrow with a razor-sharp edge.
Fired like a prayer, this blessed water greatbow arrow might be just the divine intervention you need in a hot situation.
This cute little greatbow arrow infused with a charming potion is quite something. You really, really, really like it.
A fire greatbow arrow that is hot to the touch. You probably want to keep it safely away from oils and suchlike.
A cursed greatbow arrow that lands like a witch's kiss, draining the fervour of any foe.
Known as 'Arrow of the Dragon Slayer' to the renowned Lapiterran archers, this explosive projectile will just as soon blow up in your face as at your enemy's feet.
A frost-capped greatbow arrow that bites deep and stops targets in their tracks.
A lead-weight greatbow arrow that's almost too heavy to fire. Almost.
Look closely; the only visible difference between this greatbow arrow and a normal greatbow arrow can be seen in the sizzling dents within the tip of the arrowhead.
A sharp greatbow arrow shimmering beneath a toxic green mist; best not to inhale as you release this venomous cloud.
A greatbow arrow covered in acid that eats away at armor. Miraculously, it failed to degrade your quiver.
This greatbow arrow is sure to slow your foes in their tracks as well as put a spring in your step.
An occluding greatbow arrow was made from a recipe stolen from the chronicles of the Kallavi, an elusive troupe of burglars.
Wreathed in sparking energy, this greatbow arrow can unleash a tempest upon its unlucky target.
A hissing greatbow arrow packed tight with steam. This baby is ready to explode; shield your eyes as you nock and load.
An greatbow arrow infused with the fury of the air. If you listen closely you can hear it whistle and seethe with anticipation.
The artistry is all in the cunning way you affix the flask of water to the greatbow arrow. Or so you've been told.
A greatbow said to fire arrows so large that they shatter both men and mountains alike.
A greatbow enhanced with modern technological advances. Still requires great strength to wield.
A military-issue greatbow, crafted for a long-forgotten regiment said to have hunted flying magical beasts.
A high quality greatbow, crafted by an master artisan. This artifact is said to have slain dragons.
A blade forged in a nation far to the east. Cuts through flesh and bone with ease.
A large, long blade forged in a nation far to the east. Requires considerable strength to wield.
An old pipe. Functions as a makeshift quarterstaff.
A heavy staff with a tough grip. Functions as a balanced offensive and defensive weapon.
A sturdy staff with a balanced weight. Functions as both a walking stick, and a tool to bash skulls.
A sturdy wooden staff with a heavy, metal end. A balanced weapon with a respectable reach.
A lightweight blade with a razor-sharp point. Perfect for those who wish to dance along the battlefield.
A lightweight blade with a razor-sharp point. Perfect for those who wish to dance along the battlefield.

A blade forged in a nation far to the east. Easily concealable and light, this blade is favored by assassins.

An anvil attached to a handle. As simple as that.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

The end of the Runic Cannon glimmers like a dazzling gem, powered by runic magic.
Unequipping this requires detaching the safeties near your arm.

The holiest of bibles, this is a sacred relic to the Divine Order of Lucian.
While a typical priest would use this book for sermons, a more apt warrior may put its size to good use as a bludgeoning weapon.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.
A scholar's dearest weapon. Beat them down with KNOWLEDGE!

An oversized scroll that once belonged to an ogre.
Despite having no talent for magic, Gnak was worshipped by his kind as an all-powerful Ogre Magi.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.
A wooden sword typically used for training.
A wooden sword typically used for training.

A portable cannon (otherwise known as a blunderbuss) capable of discharging firey bursts of lead.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

A hardened tube that houses an eternal flame, powered by a dragon's heart.
Bathes enemies in flames like a dragon would.Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

A legendary greatbow that once belonged to the hero known as the God of Thunder.
Strikes enemies down with the power of the heavens.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

A unique grimoire. Unlocks the power of Death Magic.
Grimoires grow in level with their owner, and unlock new bonuses every few levels.

A unique grimoire. Unlocks the power of Fire Magic.

The personal axe of Balrin, a Dwarven Berserker known for his legendary axe throwing.
Automatically levels up with the wearer.

An ancient blade forged from runic metal, and tempered with the fire of a legendary elemental.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

A legendary cursed blade, said to have absorbed the hatred of its victims.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

An electrified katana, once wielded by a slayer of demons.

The full potential of this blade has been realized through the Shiden Orb.

A magical staff said to be able to extend to great lengths. Once wielded by a warrior of legend.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

A rare estoc forged from runic metal. Etched with runes signifying "Ice", this blade pierces hearts with a bitter chlll.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

A mysterious Runeblade said to harness the power of Chaos.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

A trick weapon capable of combining into one large scythe, or splitting into two separate weapons.
Its blade is forged with an otherworldly material known as siderite, said to have fallen from the heavens.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

A wicked scythe once wielded by an infamous reaper. At night, you swear you can hear the skull quietly chattering...
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

A deadly scythe once belonging to the being known as "The Harvester", said to have reaped countless souls in an unending thirst for power.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

The second piece to one masterful trick weapon.
Said to have been wielded by wielded by Gehrman, the first hunter.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.
A pair of two shields, designed to be used with both arms. For those who truly want to become an unstoppable wall.

A holy banner of the Divine Order, said to inspire all with its glory. Huzzah!

A trick weapon capable of combining into one large scythe, or splitting into two separate weapons.
Its blade is forged with an otherworldly material known as siderite, said to have fallen from the heavens.
Automatically levels up with the wearer, gaining new bonuses at various levels.

An imposing, heavy slab of metal, crafted from a mysterious alloy. A single eye, embedded in the hilt pulsates ever so slighly.

An ethereal blade, flickering ever so slightly. Said to have once belonged to a merciless wraith who eagerly persued its prey.

content.OT: Can Backstab. Backstabbing deals critical damage when you attack from behind your target.
Destroy [1] on target character, and set Acid status.

contentList.content: Deal [1] to target character, destroying <font color='#A8A8A8'>Physical Armour</font> and setting Acid.

content.OT: Destroy [1] on targets in a cone, and set Acid and Atrophy.

contentList.content: Deal [1] to targets in a cone, destroying <font color='#A8A8A8'>Physical Armour</font> and setting Acid and Atrophy.

content.Comment: For replacing 'Requires tag' when using tag requirements

content.OT: Drain [1] from target character and gain that amount for yourself.

contentList.content: Deal [1] to target character, draining that amount as <font color='#188EDE'>Magic Armour</font>.

content.OT: Throw a knife at your opponent, dealing [1]. Can backstab!

contentList.content:
Throw a knife at your opponent, dealing [1]. Can backstab!
Dagger Mastery I
The knife thrown has a small chance to be coated in poison or explosive oil, dealing additional damage on hit.
